intro: Psychotria zapotecana, commonly known as the Zapotec Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. Psychotria zapotecana is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses by local indigenous communities.
